intro: Centaurea paniculata subsp. cosana, commonly known as the Cosine Centaury, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It features upright, branching stems that are covered in soft, grayish-green leaves with toothed margins. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
